column2: 01) Link Type             = Must be homogenous currently only Direct is propserly supported
02) Optical Link #        = Number of optical link used
03) Daisy Chain #         = Number of board in daisy chain
04) VME Base Address      = Base Address set by rotoary switches on board
05) Enable Autoflush      = For Low rates this is used to force buffer flushes between 16 and 32ms even when buffer not full (T/F)
06) Propogate Triggers    = (T/F) necessary if doing coincidences
07) Record Waveforms      = (T/F) activate recording of waveforms
08) Analog Probe          = 0-2
09) Dual Trace            = 0-1 (see 725-7230 DPP-PSD Registers manual for details about selections)
10) Record Extras Word    = T/F
11) Dig Virt Probe 1      = 0
column8: 7 (see 725-7230 DPP-PSD Registers manual for details about selections)

column2: 12) Dig Virt Probe 2      = 0
column8: 7 (see 725-7230 DPP-PSD Registers manual for details about selections)

column2: 13) Num of chan buff/agg  = log2(# of channel/pair aggregates per memory) valid choices are 2
column14: ...  buffers) see dpp psd for more info

column2: 14) Acq Trig Counting     = 0->Only count accepted triggers
15) Mem Full Mode         = 0->Wait till all buffs are full
column3: 1->wait till all but 1 buff are full

column2: 16) PLL Ref Clock         = 0->Internal Oscillator
17) Glb ChPair Trig Mask  = 8 bit binary value corresponding to which pairs of channels participate in global trigger generation
18) Glb Coin Window       = coincidence time window (in mobo clock units)
19) Glb Maj Level         = # channel pairs - 1 that must fire to cause a trig out
20) Ext Trig              = (T/F) OR external trigger with internal trigger
21) ChanPair TrigOut Mask = 8 bit binary value corresponding to which pairs of channels participate in trigger output
22) Trig Out Gen Logic    = 0->OR
23) Majority Level        = trg-out fires when at least m+1 of the enabled trigger requests are set
24) Ext Trig in TrigOut   = External trigger participates in logical OR with trig out generation
25) Mem Buffer Almst Full = Level of mem buffer usage required to trigger mem almost full output
column3: 0= completely full refer to V1730 user manual for more info

column2: 26) Run Strt/Stop Delay   = Time in trigger clock cycles to delay starting and stopping of run from recieving signal
27) Use Ext Trigger       = T/F (enable or disable usage of external trigger)
28) Interrupt Event Count = Number of Events to trigger an interrupt request
29) # Aggre per BLT       = max number of complete aggregates to transfer for each block transfer
column3: big number for high rate small number for low rate [1
column5: there is no point making it much larger than the number of aggregates per channel)
